question.text: During prolonged fastings, in what sequence are the following organic compounds used up by the body ?

options.text: first carbohydrates, next fats and lastly proteins
first fats, next carbohydrates and lastly proteins
first carbohydrates, next proteins and lastly lipids
first proteins, next lipids and lastly carbohydrates

solution.text: During prolonged fasting, first carbohydrates are used up then fats and proteins are used last. Carbohydrate and fat metabolism can produce energy more easily than protein and they follow a more or less simple pathway to enter into TCA cycle. When all carbohydrates of the body are used up then fats are converted into carbohydrates and when all fats are used up then ultimately proteins of the body are converted into carbohydrates to be used up by the body.
